title: Philip Morris International's Profit Falls As Costs Increase
text:
By Allison Prang

Philip Morris International Inc.'s (PM) earnings fell as marketing, administration and research costs rose by a little over 30%.

Earnings were $1.9 billion, down 16% from the comparable quarter a year earlier. Earnings were $1.22 a share, down from $1.44 a share.

Adjusted earnings were $1.43 a share, down from $1.44 a share.

Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting earnings of $1.36 a share.

Net revenue was $7.64 billion, up 1.8%. Analysts were expecting $7.65 billion.

Pension and other employee benefit costs rose by almost three times as much from a year earlier to $20 million.
